directions: You may use the tables provided to help answer the question below, but you do not need to.

questions.text: Car A has a mass of 2200. kg and a velocity of 11 m/s. Car B has a mass of 2000. kg and a velocity of 8.0 m/s in the same direction. They collide and stick together. What is their speed after the collision?

Car A has a mass of 2800. kg and a velocity of 3.0 m/s. Car B has a mass of 2400. kg and a velocity of 4.5 m/s in the same direction. They collide and stick together. What is their speed after the collision?

A train with a mass of 20 million kilograms is moving with a speed of 40 m/s. Another train with a mass of 50 million kilograms is coming up behind it with a speed of 60 m/s. When the faster train reaches the slower, they connect. What is their speed after?
A 112 kg linebacker flies at 25 m/s into a stationary 96 kg quarterback. He wraps the quarterback up and they begin moving together. What is their speed?
